_comment: You can use Markup in any of the values below. Do not change the keys of the data.

Description: Name of context or context used consistent with outputs of merge_xomics.py

Name of Genome-scale metabolic model to seed the context model to.
For example, the GeneralModelUpdatedV2.mat, is a modified Recon3D model.
We also provide iMM_madrid for mouse. OT can be .mat, .xml, or .json.

Path to logical table of active genes output from merge_xomics.py called ActiveGenes_contextName_Merged.csv.
Should be in the corresponding context/context folder inside /main/data/results/contextName/.
The json file output from the function using the context of interest as the key can be used here.
Reaction ID of the objective function in the model. Generally a biomass function.

Path to file contains the exchange (media), sink, and demand reactions
     which the model should use to fulfill the reactions governed by transcriptomic and proteomics data inputs.
It must be a csv or xlsx with three columns: `Rxn`, `Lowerbound`, `Upperbound`.
If not specified, MADRID will allow ALL BOUNDARY REACTIONS THAT ARE OPEN IN THE REFERENCE MODEL TO BE USED!

Filepath to file that contains reactions which will be removed from active reactions the model to use when seeding,
     even if considered active from transcriptomic and proteomics data inputs.
It must be a csv or xlsx with one column of reaction IDs consistent with the reference model

Filepath to file that contains reactions which will be added to active reactions for the model to use when seeding
     (unless it causes the model to be unsolvable),
     regardless of results of transcriptomic and proteomics data inputs.
It must be a csv or xlsx with one column of reaction IDs consistent with the reference model

Algorithm used to seed context specific model to the Genome-scale model.
Can be either GIMME, FASTCORE, iMAT, or tINIT.
Low to mid bin cutoff for iMAT solution
Mid to high bin cutoff for iMAT solution

Solver used to seed model and attempt to solve objective.
Default is GLPK. Also takes GUROBI but you must mount a container license to the Docker to use.
An academic license can be obtained for free.
See the README on the Github or Dockerhub for information on mounting this license.

Filetypes to save seeded model type.
Can be either a string with one filetype such as 'xml' or multiple in the format "['extension1', 'extension2', ... etc]".
If you want to output in all 3 accepted formats, would be: "['mat', 'xml', 'json']"
NOTE: Outer quotes are required to be interpreted by cmd. This a string, not a python list

The path to the configuration file specified under
`/main/data/config_sheets/disease/diease_data_inputs_`
The type of context being used (i.e., naiveB, smB, etc.)
Source of data being used, either rnaseq or microarray
BioDbNet taxon ID number, also accepts 'human', or 'mouse'
The context-specific model file, (must be .mat, .xml, or .json
Name of context, tissue, cell-type, etc.
The name of the disease
The name of the disease up-regulated file
The name of the disease down-regulated file
The name of the raw drug file
The name of the reference flux file
Test all genes, even ones predicted to have little no effect

Flag to merge zFPKM distributions.
Required if using iMAT reconstruction algorithm in create_context_specific_model.py.
Must have run rnaseq_gen.py with 'zFPKM' as `--technique`.
If `--proteomics-config-file` is given will merge proteomics distributions with
zFPKM distributions using a weighted scheme.
Name of microarray Excel configuration file found under `/main/data/config_files/`
The name of the total RNA-seq Excel configuration file found under `/main/data/config_files/`
The name of the mRNA-seq Excel configuration file found under `/main/data/config_files/`
The name of the single cell RNA-seq Excel configuration file found under `/main/data/config_files/`
The name of the proteomics Excel configuration file found udner `/main/data/config_files/`
Number of sources with active gene for it to be considered active even if it is not a high confidence-gene
Technique to adjust expression requirement based on differences in number of provided data source types
Total RNA-seq weight for merging zFPKM distribution
PolyA enriched (messenger) RNA-seq weight for merging zFPKM distribution
Single-cell RNA-seq weight for merging zFPKM distribution
Proteomics weight for merging z-score distribution
Flag to prevent high-confidence genes forcing a gene to be used in final model irrespective of other other data sources
The configuration file name to use
The ratio of replicates required for a gene to be considered active in that sample

The ratio of replicates to be considered "high confidence".
High confidence genes are considered expressed no matter what other data sources say
The ratio of batches required for a gene to be considered active in that sample

The ratio of batches to be considered "high confidence".
High confidence genes are considered expressed no matter what other data sources say
The percentage to be considered for each quantile
The configuration file name to use
The proportion of replicates with expression required for high-confidence
The proportion of samples with expression required for gene
The proportion of replicates with expression required for high-confidence
The proportion of replicates with expression required for high-confidence
The filtering technique; one of: (1) `"quantile"`, (2) `"cpm"`, or (3) `"zfpkm"`
The cutoff for CPM filtering, if using zFPKM as the `--filt-technique`
The library prepartion method; one of: (1) `"total"`, (2) `"mRNA"`, or `"SC"`
A list of cell types
The format your gene input is in
The BioDBNet Taxon ID

Should the gene matrix be created,
or are you providing a matrix?
